associated_activity_logs.name: IPA Phone Screen
associated_activity_logs.extra_log_types:
_default:
  showable_if:
    # Prevent showing the phone screen activities if 
    # the user is an RA and an exit survey has been sent
    # or the subject withdrew
    not_all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: follow_up_surveys
      dynamic_model__ipa_surveys:
        select_survey_type: exit survey     
      user:
        role_name: ra
    not_any: &not_any_withdrawn
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: withdraw


start_phone_screen:
  label: Start Phone Screening
  fields:
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screening:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  caption_before:
    all_fields: Record initial screening responses. If necessary, enter a date and time to follow up. 
    submit: If the subject is ready to continue, save this form, and continue with the Football Experience form.
  view_options:
    show_embedded_at_top: true
  creatable_if: 
    not_any:
      dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
        select_still_interested: "yes"
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn
  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create:
      create_next_creatable:
        if: 
          all:
            dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
              select_still_interested: "yes"
      show_panel:
        value: activity_log__ipa_assignments
        if:
          not_any:
            dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
              select_still_interested: "yes"
      hide_panel:
        value: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens
        if:
          not_any:
            dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
              select_still_interested: "yes"


section_1:
  label: Football Experience
  fields: 
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_football_experience:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: start_phone_screen
      dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
        select_still_interested: "yes"        
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: section_1
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable


section_2:
  label: Size
  fields: 
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_size:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: section_1
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: section_2
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable


health_1:
  label: Health
  fields: 
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_health:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: section_2
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: health_1
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable

sleep_1:
  label: Sleep
  fields: 
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_sleep:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: health_1
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: sleep_1
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable

mri_1:
  label: MRI
  fields: 
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_mri:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: sleep_1
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: mri_1
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable


tms_1:
  label: TMS
  fields: 
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_tms_test:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: mri_1
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: tms_1
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable

schedule_callback:
  label: Schedule Callback
  fields:
    - callback_date
    - callback_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    all_fields: |
      Thank you for your patience and for answering these previous questions.
      Please note that if you are eligible and enroll in this pilot study, we will keep this information with your research records. If you are not eligible or choose not to participate we will destroy it.
      I have recorded your answers to the questions and these will be reviewed by a study physician to determine whether you are eligible for the pilot study. We will then contact you to let you know if you are eligible or not. If you are eligible, we will let you know the next steps.
      Do you have any questions?
      We will call you back to inform you of your eligibility status. What is a good day/time to call you?

    submit: If you have any questions in the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact us. Thank you again for your time.
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: tms_1
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: schedule_callback
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize

  save_action:
    on_create: create_next_creatable


tmoca_1:
  label: T-MoCA
  fields:
  references:
    dynamic_model__ipa_ps_tmoca:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  creatable_if: 
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: schedule_callback
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: tmoca_1
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize

finalize:
  label: Finalize Entries
  caption_before:
    all_fields: |
      When finalized the phone screen forms are locked from editing.
    submit: |
      Save this entry to lock the phone screen forms and generate an inclusion/exclusion checklist record.
      Click the cancel button instead if review or revision of the phone screen forms is still required.
  creatable_if:
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: tmoca_1
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
    not_any2: *not_any_withdrawn

  editable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens:
        extra_log_type: finalize
  save_action:
    on_create:
      show_panel:
        value: activity_log__ipa_assignment_inex_checklists
      hide_panel:
        value: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens
  # Override the default that hides activities after a certain stage,
  # so that any user can see that the phone screen process has been completed
  showable_if:
    always: true

associated_activity_logs.name: IPA Tracker
associated_activity_logs.extra_log_types:
_definitions:
  creatable_if: &prevent_create
    not_any_withdraw:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - withdraw
    not_any_ineligible:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no: 'no'
  

_default:
  view_options:
    hide_unless_creatable: true

  showable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: withdraw

  creatable_if:
    <<: *prevent_create


schedule_screening:
  label: Schedule Screening
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the phone screening?
    select_record_from_player_contacts: Phone number to call
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes for the screener    
  creatable_if:
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - screening_follow_up
          - withdraw
  field_options:
    select_record_from_player_contacts:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_record_from_player_contact_phone

screening_follow_up:
  label: Schedule Screening Follow Up
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the phone screening follow up?
    select_record_from_player_contacts: Phone number to call
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes
  creatable_if:
    <<: *prevent_create
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - appointment  

      
perform_screening_follow_up:
  label: Perform Screening Follow Up
  references:
    ipa_screening:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
  caption_before:
    all_fields: Record the eligibility of the participant and any additional notes from the phone screening follow up.
    submit: If unable to complete the follow up, and it is necessary to schedule a repeat follow up in the future, add a Schedule Screening Follow Up to set a time.
  creatable_if:
    <<: *prevent_create
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - appointment

      

appointment:
  label: Appointment
  fields:

  references:
    ipa_appointment:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
  creatable_if:
    <<: *prevent_create
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: perform_screening_follow_up

contact_info:
  label: Emergency Contacts
  fields:

  references:

    emergency_contact:
      from: master
      add: many   

  creatable_if:
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - withdraw


mrn:
  label: MRN
  fields:

  references:
    mrn_number:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master   
  creatable_if:
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - withdraw

  save_trigger:
    on_create:
      notify:
        type: email
        role: clinical research coordinator
        layout_template: ipa notification layout
        content_template: ipa message content
        subject: "IPA App: Subject MRN assigned"
 

transportation_and_housing:
  label: Transportation and Housing
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_transportation:
      from: master
      add: many
      limit: 2
      view_as:
        new: not_embedded
        edit: not_embedded
    ipa_hotel:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
      view_as:
        new: not_embedded
        edit: not_embedded
  creatable_if:
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment

associated_reports.name: Search IPA Subject
associated_reports.description:
Search players by name, phone, email or ID.
Leave the search field empty to see all subjects.
associated_reports.sql:
select distinct m.id master_id, 
pi.first_name, pi.middle_name, pi.last_name, pi.nick_name,
a.street, a.street2, a.city, a.state, a.zip, 
pc.data, pc.rec_type
from masters m
inner join player_infos pi
on pi.master_id = m.id 
inner join ipa_assignments b
on m.id = b.master_id
left join addresses a
on m.id = a.master_id
left join player_contacts pc
on pc.master_id = m.id
where 
(:name is null 
or pi.first_name ~* :name
or pi.last_name ~* :name
or pi.middle_name ~* :name
or pi.nick_name ~* :name
or( 
    pi.first_name ~* coalesce(split_part(:name, ' ', 1),'none')
    AND pi.last_name ~* coalesce(split_part(:name, ' ', 2),'none')
  )
) OR
(
regexp_replace(pc.data, '\W+', '', 'g') ~* regexp_replace(:name, '\W+', '', 'g')
) OR
(
b.ipa_id::varchar = :name
)
associated_reports.search_attrs:
name: 
  text: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Subjects Pending Sync
associated_reports.description: Show IPA subjects that have been created here, but have not yet been transferred from Zeus.
associated_reports.sql:
select b.master_id from ipa_assignments b
left join player_infos pi
on b.master_id = pi.master_id
where b.master_id IS NOT NULL
AND pi.id is null
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviation PI Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring review by the PI.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.*,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 INNER JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type in ('pi_review', 'initial_review')
 AND p.select_severity = 'major'


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type = 'initial_review'
AND
  r = 1 AND dt.extra_log_type <> 'pi_review'

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Event PI Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring review by the PI.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.*,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 INNER JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type in ('pi_review', 'initial_review')
 AND p.select_relatedness IN ('related', 'possibly related') AND p.select_expectedness = 'unexpected'
 AND (p.select_location = 'internal' OR p.select_severity = 'serious')


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type = 'initial_review'
AND
  r = 1 AND dt.extra_log_type <> 'pi_review'

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Appointments
associated_reports.sql:
select ap.master_id, pi.first_name, pi.last_name, visit_start_date, select_navigator, max(ap.id) from ipa_appointments ap
inner join activity_log_ipa_assignments al
on al.master_id = ap.master_id

inner join player_infos pi
on ap.master_id = pi.master_id

where 
(:from_date IS NULL OR :from_date <= now())
AND
(:to_date IS NULL OR :to_date >= now())
GROUP BY
ap.master_id, visit_start_date, select_navigator, pi.first_name, pi.last_name
ORDER BY visit_start_date asc
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
from_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: -10 days
to_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Outstanding Activities
associated_reports.description: Search for records where one activity has been performed and another hasn't been performed after it (optional).
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT id,
   master_id,
   extra_log_type,
   select_result,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY master_id 
  ORDER BY created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments
 WHERE
  :activity_performed = 'general-follow-up' AND extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='follow up'
 OR
  :activity_performed = 'general-completed' AND extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='completed'
 OR
  :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='follow up'
 OR
  :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='completed'
 OR

  extra_log_type IN (:activity_performed, :activity_outstanding) 

) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id

WHERE
  r = 1 
AND ( 
  :activity_performed = 'general-follow-up' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.select_result='follow up'
 OR
  :activity_performed = 'general-completed' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.select_result='completed'
 OR
  dt.extra_log_type = :activity_performed
)

ORDER BY
  dt.id DESC
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
activity_performed: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: general-follow-up
    selections:
      general communication - follow-up: general-follow-up
      general communication - completed: general-completed
      scheduled screening: schedule_screening
      payment made: payments
      scheduled screening follow-up: screening_follow_up
      performed screening follow-up: perform_screening_follow_up
      set appointment: appointment
      added emergency contacts: contact_info
      transportation and housing: transportation_and_housing
      consent mailing: consent_mailing
      follow up surveys: follow_up_surveys
      withdraw: withdraw


activity_outstanding: 
  config_selector: 
    label: Activity outstanding (optional)
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: general-completed
    selections:
      general communication - follow-up: general-follow-up
      general communication - completed: general-completed
      scheduled screening: schedule_screening
      payment made: payments
      scheduled screening follow-up: screening_follow_up
      performed screening follow-up: perform_screening_follow_up
      set appointment: appointment
      added emergency contacts: contact_info
      transportation and housing: transportation_and_housing
      consent mailing: consent_mailing
      follow up surveys: follow_up_surveys
      withdraw: withdraw

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviation Initial Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring initial review by the Senior Clinical Research Coordinator.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id, a2.extra_log_type, a.created_at,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type IS NULL
 AND p.select_severity = 'major'


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type IS NULL

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Event Initial Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring initial review by the Senior Clinical Research Coordinator.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.extra_log_type, a.created_at, a.master_id,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type IS NULL


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id

;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Events
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id,
coalesce(dt.created_at, dt.submitted_at) "last activity",
coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') "Last Activity Performed",
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
select_severity, select_location, select_relatedness, select_expectedness, event_occurred_when, event_discovered_when,
dt.primary_extra_log_type,
dt.primary_activity
FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id , a.id "primary_activity", a.extra_log_type "primary_extra_log_type", a.created_at "submitted_at", a2.created_at, a2.extra_log_type, p.select_severity, p.select_location, p.select_relatedness, p.select_expectedness,
   p.event_occurred_when, p.event_discovered_when,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id


 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE r = 1 

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro
associated_message_templates.template:
The potential participant will express interest by contacting the FPHS Player Relations team via email or phone at the contact information listed on the study recruitment materials.

Hello, may I please speak to Mr. {{player_info.last_name}}?

My name is XX, and I am calling (or following up) from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. Thank you for your interest in our research study to pilot the feasibility of conducting an in-person health assessment to learn more about the long-term health effects of a career in professional football.

Is this a good time to speak?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 2
associated_message_templates.template:
As you may know, The Football Players Health Study is a research study dedicated to understanding the current health and well-being of former NFL players. We are currently conducting in-person health assessments to learn more about the long-term health effects of a career in professional football.

As a first step, we are doing a pilot study to figure out if the group of assessments are feasible and tolerable over a three and a half day period. Pilot studies are done on a small group of people to learn if a larger study would be helpful and useful. This pilot study is not including former NFL players.

Would you be willing to answer questions about your health and medical history to find out if youmight qualify for the study?There are some questions about sensitive medical information involved and some of the questions may make you feel uncomfortable. [for Phase 2 only I will also be asking you to do some tasks in order to assess your attention and memory such as repeating sentences or numbers back to me.] You can stop at any time.

I will record your answers in writing, but only collect detailed contact information if you qualify for the study and want to schedule an in person visit. The detailed information needed to schedule the in person visit will be your date of birth, insurance information, an emergency contact, social security number, and address. The risk of allowing us to collect and record your name with your answers is a loss of confidentiality.We will take reasonable steps to protect the confidentiality of your information.

You will receive a $20 gift card for your time today learning about the study and answering some questions about your health and medical history. This call should take about 45 minutes of your time. May I begin?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 3
associated_message_templates.template:
Participation in this study will involve a three and a half day study visit in Boston that includes assessments of pain and physical function, memory and cognition (how people think and problem solve), sleep and heart function. Some of the testing will include mock or sham procedures, meaning that you may not undergo a certain scan or exam, but may be asked to lie in the scanner, for example, to help better understand timing and feasibility of conducting these tests in the larger study. You will be asked to stay overnight in a local hotel during this time (the cost will be covered by the study). The visits will take place at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) on the main campus, in the Charlestown Navy Yard in MGH facilities and at Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital.

There is no direct benefit to participating in this pilot study, but you will be compensated for your time. Participation in this study is voluntary.

I am going to go over the study in some more detail. Do you have any questions so far?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 4
associated_message_templates.template:
As I stated earlier, the testing will occur over 3 ½ days. As this is a pilot study, the order of the testing may vary, but this is an example of how the visit would happen (you will be provided a detailed schedule before you come if you choose to participate):

Throughout the study, a member of the study team will guide you through the visit to make sure that you get to all of the testing and to help you with any questions that you have throughout the study. They will also ensure that you have breaks and meals throughout the days.

INTERVIEWER: HAVE THE CONSENT FORM ON HAND TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DETAILS ABOUT THE STUDY VISITS AS NEEDED.

Day of arrival (Day 0)

When you arrive, you will have baseline testing. You will see the study doctor and they will go over the study and consent form with you. You will then:

Have a baseline assessment of your health such as a review of your medical history, medications, and a brief physical exam that includes body composition measures (e.g. height, weight, waist size…)

Fill out some questionnaires about your health

The first night

During the first night, you will have a sleep study in your hotel room or at the hospital. This will include having sensors placed on your body to monitor your movement, heart rate and brain waves while you sleep.

Day 1

On the first full study day, you will be asked to not eat and get your blood drawn that morning. You will have breakfast immediately following and then the following assessments will follow:

Neuropsychological testing – An assessment that consists of tests that evaluate your mood, memory and how you think, learn and solve problems.

Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of your brain and liver – A scan that takes pictures of your brain using a large magnet and radio signals

Physical function testing – Testing that consists of a series of tests such as lifting weights, a timed walking test, walking upstairs carrying weights, walking while doing another task (simple math), and testing your balance.

Sensory testing – An assessment that consists of tests to measure your sensory responses – for example, having pressure applied to different parts of your body or putting you hand in ice water – you will be asked to report when these sensations are uncomfortable.

Day 2

On the second full study day, you will be asked to fast (not eat) for the first assessment. You will have breakfast immediately following that testing. The assessments could happen as follows:

Cardiac testing – This testing consists of activities such as having pictures taken of your heart (ultrasound), being monitored while completing some tasks (e.g. breathing into a tube) and a bicycle exercise test.

Sense of smell testing – This brief test consists of breathing different odors form a tube and being asked questions about your familiarity, memory and ability to name each odor.

Electroencephalogram (EEG) – A series of electrodes (small round discs) will be placed on your head and your brain waves will be measures while you sit quietly and then while you complete a few simple tasks on a computer.

Positron Emission Tomography (PET) with Computed Tomography (CT) – PET/CT scans take pictures of what is going on inside the body using special dyes with radiation that “light up” inside the body to make a picture. You will be undergoing “mock” PET scans to help us better understand the timing and feasibility of conducting this testing in the larger study. This means that you will not receive the special dyes and will not be exposed to any radiation. You may be prepped and asked questions that may not apply, but are important for the study team to pilot. The scanner is shaped like a big ring and you will be positioned on your back on the scanner table. The table may move forward and backward as part of the testing the procedures.

You will have two mock scans in one day, one earlier in the day and one later in the day. In the larger study, the difference between the scan is the dye that is used and what we are trying to see in the brain with that dye.

Day 3

On the third day, you will have the following assessments:

PET/CT – You will have an additional mock PET brain scan where you will be prepped and asked to lie in the scanner to assess timing and feasibility. You will not receive any special dye, injection or be exposed to radiation.

X-rays – You will undergo a mock X-ray exam, similar to the mock PET scans, where you may be asked questions, prepped and asked to stand in the equipment to pilot these procedures. You will not be exposed to any radiation.

MRI Connectome – Some people will have another MRI of the brain. This will be similar to the other MRI, but will be done in a different scanner that takes more detailed pictures of your brain.

Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) – The TMS will measure brain plasticity. Brain plasticity is the ability of the brain to change and learn through experience. TMS is a noninvasive way of stimulating the brain. TMS uses a magnetic field to cause activity in the brain. The magnetic field is produced by a coil that is held next to your scalp. In this study, we will use TMS to create activity in your brain and will measure your brain’s response to the activity. This is how we measure brain plasticity.

Cognitive Testing – You will be asked to complete two brief cognitive tasks (tests that assess your thinking) on an iPad or computer. One task will ask you several questions about decisions that you make and preferences that you have in areas such as your finances and health. During the second task, you will be asked several questions pertaining to your current level of optimism and how you predict the likelihood of certain life events occurring.

INTERVIEWER: OFFER TO SEND THE SUBJECT STUDY SUMMARY, CONSENT FORM, AND CONSENT FORM SUPPLEMENTS THROUGHOUT.

Are you still interested in hearing more about the study or do you have any additional questions? (offer to mail materials and call them back if they want to review materials)
